definition: to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: This naughty boy the profile that picture choosing keeps from him Todd.
sentences.chinese: 這幅調皮男孩兒的畫像選自託德自己寫的小傳。

sentences.english: It is posted on the company's website and handed out at the slightest excuse.
sentences.chinese: 個人小傳登在公司網站上，而且動不動就被髮送出去。

sentences.english: My boss asked me to write a profile for the new tennis champion.
sentences.chinese: 我上司讓我給這位新網球冠軍寫篇小傳。

sentences.english: Two CEO biogs stand out from the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 有兩家公司執行長的個人小傳出類拔萃。

sentences.english: The village paper published biographical sketches of the boys.
sentences.chinese: 村裏的報紙還刊登了兩個小孩的小傳。

sentences.english: The village paper published biographical sketches of the two boys.
sentences.chinese: 村裏的報紙還發表了這兩個孩子的小傳。

sentences.english: Brissenden.Please send by return mail his photograph and biographical data.
sentences.chinese: 請於賜復時附寄布里森登先生照片及小傳。

sentences.english: The biog is a curious document.
sentences.chinese: 個人小傳是一種有趣的文件。

definition: short comment or critical appraisal added at the end of a text, on a painting etc
to comment/a point by point commentary
study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries

notes on poetry, an essay genre consisting of informal commentary on poems and poets and their lives (old)/a genre of narrative literature interspersing prose with poetry, popular in the Tang and Song dynasties
variant of 匯編|汇编[hui4 bian1]
